issues.title: Identity binding description
issues.author: nedmsmith
issues.body: There probably should be text that reinforces the identity to attestation claims binding semantics. Presumably the certificate identity fields identify the entity to which the attestation claims (attributes) belong. A point of possible ambiguity is whether those properties apply generally across the entire entity (endpoint) or do they apply to something within the endpoint that is more specific (granular). If more granular, then there needs to be a way to name / identify the more granular component. If they are intended to apply more coarsely, does that application result in, what some my describe as escalation of privilige, where the attribute (quality of trust) is unjustifiably ascribed to some parts of the endpoint?

issues.title: Review from Russ
issues.author: hannestschofenig
issues.body:
You define:

        AR-Claims ::= SEQUENCE SIZE (1..MAX) OF ReportedEntity

This seems odd.  Consider:

        ARClaims ::= SEQUENCE SIZE (1..MAX) OF ARClaim

Also, why not use AttributeSet as specified in RFC 5912.

reviews.author: hannestschofenig
reviews.body: Great update, Tiru. I would merge it because I believe it is a significant improvement for the draft.

pulls.title: Update draft to address comments from the WG
pulls.author: tireddy2

comments.author: hannestschofenig
comments.body: I believe the PR is good! Thanks for the work on it, Tiru.

reviews.author: mwiseman32
reviews.body: I still think we need a description of the key's certificate "life-cycle" that may drive some changes to this. However, this is a significant  improvement and should be merged.

comments.body:
```suggestion
Steps 1 to 3, including the generation of an Attestation Result, its inclusion in a CSR, and its verification by a Registration Authority are already specified in {{I-D.ietf-rats-pkix-key-attestation}}. 
```

```suggestion
The AR-Claims field represents a sequence of Attestation Results claims (ReportedEntity) added by the CA in the certificate. It MUST contain at least one claim. For privacy reasons, the CA MAY choose to include only a subset of the claims from the Attestation Result it received from a Verifier. The CA's certificate profile can specify which Attestation Result claims (identified by OIDs) MAY be copied from the CSR; any others MUST NOT be copied. By omitting the original signature from the attestation evidence, the CA is stating that it has validated the Attestation Results against a trusted root, but it does not have to reveal which root was used.
```

```suggestion
  * Step 5: The CA issues an X.509 certificate embedding the Attestation Results within the Attestation Results Certificate Extension.
```

```suggestion
The AR-Claims field represents a sequence of Attestation Results claims (ReportedEntity) added by the CA in the certificate. It MUST contain at least one claim. For privacy reasons, the CA MAY choose to include only a subset of the claims from the Attestation Result it received from a Verifier. The CA's certificate profile can specify which Attestation Result claims (identified by OIDs) MAY be copied from the CSR; any others MUST NOT be copied. By omitting the original signature from the Attestation Evidence, the CA is stating that it has validated the Attestation Results against a trusted root, but it does not have to reveal which root was used.
```

```suggestion
The AR-Claims field represents a sequence of Attestation Results claims (ReportedEntity) added by the CA in the certificate. It MUST contain at least one claim. For privacy reasons, the CA MAY choose to include only a subset of the claims from the Attestation Result it received from a Verifier. The CA's certificate profile can specify which Attestation Result claims (identified by OIDs) MAY be copied from the Attestation Evidence provided in the CSR; any others MUST NOT be copied.
```

reviews.author: mwiseman32
reviews.body: Regarding ";any others MUST NOT be copied.". I'd like to consider use cases were other data withing a defined context might be added. For example,  while we may not want to copy the AK Cert there may be other information about the entity that signed the Evidence Statement. Let's merge this for now to provide a working document.

reviews.author: mwiseman32
reviews.body: Generally good comments but need to review when merged.
